intro: Cymopterus ligusticoides var. puniceus, commonly known as the redroot goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and reddish-brown roots. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
